popt4jlib.MSSC

Class DetAnnealClusterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MSSC.DetAnnealClusterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClustererIntf

    public final class DetAnnealClusterer
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClustererIntf
    the class implements the Deterministic Annealing algorithm for MSSC by Rose. The class is neither multi-threaded, nor is it thread-safe.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • clusterVectors

        public java.util.Vector clusterVectors()
                                throws ClustererException
        the most important method of the class. Some parameters must have been previously passed in the _params map (call setParams(p) to do that). These are: <"a",double> the rate of annealing <"Tmin",double> the Tmin value which when reached, we stop the annealing. <"lmax",double> the λmax(Cx) which instead of being computed must be passed in <"delta",double> the δ perturbation when creating a new VectorIntf center Also, before calling the method, the documents to be clustered must have been added to the class object via addAllVectors(Vector) or via repeated calls to addVector(VectorIntf d)
        Specified by:
        clusterVectors in interface ClustererIntf
        Returns:
        Vector
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if at some iteration, one or more clusters becomes empty.
        ClustererException

      • setInitialClustering

        public void setInitialClustering(java.util.Vector centers)
                          throws ClustererException
        set the initial clustering centers the vector _centers is reconstructed, but the Document objects that are the cluster centers are simply passed as references. the _centers doesn't own copies of them, but references to the objects inside the centers vector that is passed in the param. list
        Specified by:
        setInitialClustering in interface ClustererIntf
        Parameters:
        centers - Vector Vector
        Throws:
        ClustererException - if argument is null or if any of the contained objects is not a VectorIntf

      • getClusteringIndices

        public int[] getClusteringIndices()
        returns the cluster indices for each of the clustered vectors. This value will be null if neither setClusteringIndices() nor the clusterVectors() method have been called prior to this call.
        Specified by:
        getClusteringIndices in interface ClustererIntf
        Returns:
        int[] range is in [0...k-1] where k is the number of clusters required.
